conbody.p: reducing costscontrolling costsTechnical content is often the last in line for investment and innovation, but poor content has profound effects inside and outside the organization. Before relegating technical content to the “necessary evil” role with minimal investment, consider whether it might actually be less expensive to create high-quality technical information.

The issues to consider are:
The real cost of low-cost documentation
How to create an efficient content development process
Whether high-quality documentation can lower the cost of technical support
The most cost-effective way to share technical content across the enterprise
